translated: hrem, hum, phat.

translated: At the navel one should visualize the seed syllables om and vam, which are the nature of Vajravarahi, who is red in color.

original: de nas lag pa la gnas pa'i 'byung bas dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams ltung byed ma dang gsod byed ma dang / 'gugs byed ma dang / gar gyi dbang phyug ma dang / padma'i dra ba can gyi rang bzhin du lhag par mos par bya'o //

translated: Then one should imagine that the elements located in the hand, namely, earth, water, fire, wind, and space, are the nature of Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, Rūpiṇī, Ghasmarī, and Pukkasi, respectively.

original: de nas lag pa la gnas pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge dag la khu ba'i rdzas kyis byugs te lag mthil de dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'khor lo gsum gyi rang bzhin du lhag par mos par byas nas khu pa
analyzed: de nas lag pa la gnas pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge dag la khu ba'i rdzas kyis byugs te lag mthil de dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'khor lo gsum gyi rang bzhin du lhag par mos par byas nas khu pa
translated: Then, having anointed the seed syllables located in the hands with the substance of semen, one should imagine that the palms of the hands are blessed by all heroes and yoginīs as having the nature of the three wheels.

original: la sogs pa'i rdzas de yi ge gsum gyi sngags sam rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rdzas de yi ge gsum gyi sngags sam rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer the substance of semen, etc., with the mantra of the three syllables or the mantra of the eight lines.

original: de nas yang dag par mchod nas cho ga lhag pa dang ma tshang ba dag par bya ba'i don du yi ge brgya pa'i sngags bton te /
analyzed: de nas yang dag par mchod nas cho ga lhag pa dang ma tshang ba dag par bya ba'i don du yi ge brgya pa'i sngags bton te /
translated: Then, having made offerings, one should recite the mantra of the one hundred syllables in order to purify the deficiencies and incompletions of the rite.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba btab nas rdzas gzhan nam yang na de ma yin pa gzhan du gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba btab nas rdzas gzhan nam yang na de ma yin pa gzhan du gzhag ste /
translated: Having supplicated for the sake of blessing the gaṇacakra, one should place the substance in another place or not.

original: lag pa'i mthil du sbyar ba'i rdzas srin lag gis blangs pa las snying ga dang lte ba dang mgo rnams su yi ge h'um dang a'a: dang aom brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas byugs pa na lha'i tshogs de dag bdag nyid la zhugs par mos @49a * //

translated: The substances applied to the palm of the hand are taken with the ring finger, and when applied to the heart, navel, and head, with the recitation of the syllables hūṃ, āḥ, and oṃ, respectively, one should imagine that the assembly of deities enters into oneself.

original: par bya'o // cho ga 'di yang kun spyod pa'i rgyud dang 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: par bya'o // cho ga 'di yang kun spyod pa'i rgyud dang 'brel ba yin no //

original: lag pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of hand worship.

analyzed: yang na sngar brjod pa'i chogs sbyangs pa'i lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gis gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du pu dz'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi brjod cing ji ltar sbyangs pa'i chang gis gru gsum gnyis
translated: Or else, with the ring finger of the left hand purified by the previously mentioned rite, one should recite the twenty-four syllables beginning with pu ja, in the nature of the abode, neighboring abode, and so on, and with the purified wine, one should anoint two triangles

original: byugs nas de'i dbus su yang dkyil 'khor zlum po'o //

original: de la bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa yi ge gsum ma ma rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis phul nas padma'i snod la gnas pa'i chang bdud rtsir bsgrubs pa srin lag dang mthe bos blangs te

translated: Having taken the beer that is accomplished as nectar with one's ring finger and thumb, which is located in a lotus vessel,

original: de nas yang dag par mchod nas ma tshang ba dang lhag pa dag par bya pa'i don du yi ge brgya pa bton nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba gdab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang dag par mchod nas ma tshang ba dang lhag pa dag par bya pa'i don du yi ge brgya pa bton nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba gdab pa'o //
translated: Then, having made offerings, in order to purify the incomplete and the excessive, one should recite the one-hundred-syllable mantra, and in order to bless the gaṇacakra, one should make a supplication.
